testprocedure.test-case-summary: This test procedure is called by a test case and is used to verify the SUTs support of the dlDeviceCancelControlRequest dialog as an EC using variables provided by the calling test case. This procedure supports verification of requirements related to user need 2.3.5.4.7 [Need to Cancel DMS Message Requests] and is used for both valid and invalid test cases.

testStep.functionId: Step 1 CONFIGURE: Determine the Application Layer Standard that will be used for this test. RECORD this information as: ApplicationLayerStandard: ${ApplicationLayerStandard}

Step 2 CONFIGURE: Determine whether Operator Identifier - Cancel Device Control is required by the specification. (NRTM 3.3.5.1.6.2.2.1). RECORD this information as: TMDD_N43R424_Operator_Identifier___Cancel_Device_Control_Supported = ${TMDD_N43R424_Operator_Identifier___Cancel_Device_Control_Supported}
Step 3 CONFIGURE: Define the response message that will be sent to the SUT. RECORD this information as: ResponseMessage: ${ResponseMessage}
Step 4 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the Authentication parameters need to be verified within this test. RECORD this information as: AuthenticationCheck: ${AuthenticationCheck}
Step 5 CONFIGURE: Identify the Username expected for authentication during this test. RECORD this information as: Username: ${Username}
Step 6 CONFIGURE: Identify the Password expected for authentication during this test. RECORD this information as: Password: ${Password}
Step 7 CONFIGURE: Identify the Organization Identifier expected for authentication during this test. RECORD this information as: OrganizationID: ${OrganizationID}
Step 8 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the SUT will be allowed access to the information requested in this test. RECORD this information as: AllowAccess: ${AllowAccess}
Step 9 CONFIGURE: Determine whether an error response message is expected for this test. RECORD this information as: ErrorResponseExpected: ${ErrorResponseExpected}
Step 10 CONFIGURE: IF ErrorResponseExpected is true, determine the expected error code response for this test. RECORD this information as: ErrorTypeExpected: ${ErrorTypeExpected}
Step 11 CONFIGURE: Determine whether the SUT is expected to have valid data available for a response message in this test. RECORD this information as: DataValid: ${DataValid}

Step 12 REQUEST-RESPONSE-OC-RECEIVE with the following parameters: DIALOG=dlDeviceCancelControlRequest RESPONSETIMEREQUIRED= AUTHENTICATIONCHECK = AuthenticationCheck USERNAME = Username PASSWORD = Password ORGANIZATIONID = OrganizationID ALLOWACCESS = AllowAccess ERRORRESPONSEEXPECTED = ErrorResponseExpected ERRORTYPEEXPECTED = ErrorTypeExpected DATAVALID = DataValid
Step 13 IF ErrorResponseExpected is not equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE, OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 13.1 VERIFY that element deviceCancelControlRequestMsg exists.
Step 13.2 VERIFY that element authentication exists within deviceCancelControlRequestMsg.
Step 13.3 VERIFY that element organization-requesting exists within deviceCancelControlRequestMsg.
Step 13.4 VERIFY that element device-id exists within deviceCancelControlRequestMsg.
Step 13.5 VERIFY that element request-id exists within deviceCancelControlRequestMsg.
Step 13.6 VERIFY that element deviceCancelControlRequestMsg exists.
Step 13.7 IF TMDD_N43R424_Operator_Identifier___Cancel_Device_Control_Supported is equal to TRUE THEN CONTINUE; OTHERWISE skip the following substeps.
Step 13.7.1 VERIFY that element operator-id exists within each instance of deviceCancelControlRequestMsg.authentication
Step 13.8 VERIFY that the values within the REQUEST message are correct per the TMDD standard and known operational conditions.

USER-VERIFY-MESSAGE.functionId: The User Verifies the message content

testStep.functionId: Step 13.9 CONFIGURE: Set OptionalContentVerified to True

Step 13.10 POSTCONDITION: REQUEST-RESPONSE-OC-REPLY with the following parameters: DIALOG=dlDeviceCancelControlRequest RESPONSETIMEREQUIRED= OPTIONALCONTENTVERIFIED = OptionalContentVerified RESPONSEMESSAGE = ResponseMessage
